newsitem.title: USA: Ex-Novell engineers accused of theft - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Ex-Novell engineers accused of theft - WSJ.

text.p: Novell Inc has filed a suit against three former engineers and their start-up company, alleging they stole software technology and breached employment contracts with Novell, the Wall Street Journal said in Monday's electronic edition.
The Journal said the suit also alleged trademark infringement, as Wolf Mountain, the name of their start-up company, is also the name of a new Novell product the men helped develop.
The company's Wolf Mountain technology used a clustering technique which enabled dozens of computers to act together like one machine, the newspaper said.
Some analysts viewed the software technology as a good weapon against rival Microsoft Corp, it said.
The three men named in the suit have denied charges but changed the company's name after Novell won a temporary restraining order in the case, the paper said.
